page.title: 15BRIDGE OF WEIR - INDUSTRY 2
page.content: { Tanning}has been carried on in this village for hundreds of years.{The {first tannery}was built on the bank of the River Gryffe and remained in operation until{1982}when a fire {destroyed it.}The other{main industry in the village used to be the{textile {industry,} but after America and other important customers learned how to make their own textiles ,Britain lost its market.{Factories}were{closed}and it was into one of these{empty {buildings}that the{Bridge of Weir {Leather Company}moved. { Worldwide}production is growing , particuarly in the{Far East.}Bridge of Weir can still be{optimistic}because of{the high quality of its products. The company supplied{leather}for the {Houses of Parliament},the passenger liner{Queen Elizebeth II}and the supersonic airliner{Concorde.
